titleStmt.title: SII 13.151: original edition by G.V. Srinivasa Rao
No. 151. (A.R. No. 232 of 1923.) KŌYIL-TĒVARĀYAṈPĒṬṬAI (NEAR PAṆḌĀRAVĀḌAI), PAPANASAM TALUK, TANJORE DISTRICT. ON THE NORTH WALL OF THE CENTRAL SHRINE, MATSYAPURĪŚVARA TEMPLE.

summary.p: This records an agreement given by the peruṅguṟi-sabhai (Big Assembly) of Siṁhavishṇu-chaturvēdimaṅgalam, a brahmadēya in Muḍichchō[ḻa*]-nāḍu in consideration of a lump sum of 200 kaḻañju of gold expressed in terms of 3000 kalam of paddy, received by them from the donor, to exempt from all taxes the village Kundamaṅgalam endowed to the temple of Bhūmisundara-Viṇṇagar-Paramasvāmi, by Kaṇṇandai Āṟivāṇaṉ Bhūmisundaraṉ alias Sundaraśōḻa-Mūvēndavēḷāṉ of Vāḻaippandal in Vāḻaippandal-nāḍu in Palkuṉṟak-kōṭṭam, a subdivision of Toṇḍai-nāḍu, who is also said to have built the temple. The donor's surname suggests that the record may be one of Sundara-Chōḷa.
